issue.title: Waters mzml fails due to ambiguity of array type labels

content.raw: It seems like it is okay to post the mzML I was using when I encountered this. It appears to be the result of some preprocessing work done by Waters's Unifi software, which did some deconvolution and extracted only MS2 scans. It couldn't be parsed by the ProteoWizard parser, and the mMass parser could only find a single spectrum in the file though there are over 50. The pymzml library also could not make sense of it, so I doubt Waters  is standards-conforming.
content.html: It seems like it is okay to post the mzML I was using when I encountered this. It appears to be the result of some preprocessing work done by Waters's Unifi software, which did some deconvolution and extracted only MS2 scans. It couldn't be parsed by the ProteoWizard parser, and the mMass parser could only find a single spectrum in the file though there are over 50. The pymzml library also could not make sense of it, so I doubt Waters is standards-conforming.
